member.name: T:Keysight.Aes.Asf.Applications.ApplicationServices
member.summary:
This is the service host for basic application wide services that either require user interaction (like messageboxes, dialogs etc.) or storage access like reading and writing files.
It defines various delegates for actions that can be rerouted thus allowing dependency injection in a simple way. All delegates are populated them default methods that issue regular actions as you would expect in a normal application. They can be overridden at any time, typically for unit testing, for injecting themed windows, for rerouting file access to a database etc. For an example on unit tests, see the tests for the Solution Catalog.
By default, the application services will take care of saving and restoring your main windows position and size (taking changes of multiple screens and resolution into account). If you want to supress this behaviour, you need to call DontSaveMainWindowPosition() before your main window is actually constructed, e.g. in your App.xaml.cs.

member.name: T:Keysight.Aes.Asf.Applications.ApplicationServices.MainWindowCoordinates
member.summary: Helper type to uniquely identify the main window coordinates in the GlobalSettings.

member.name: P:Keysight.Aes.Asf.Applications.ApplicationServices.MainWindowCoordinates.SerializedWindowPlacement
member.summary: Gets or sets the serialized window placement.

member.name: M:Keysight.Aes.Asf.Applications.ApplicationServices.DisableMainWindowPlacementSaveAndRestore
member.summary: Call this if you don't want to save and restore the main window position. Call this before your main window is constructed, e.g. do it in App.xaml.cs.

member.name: M:Keysight.Aes.Asf.Applications.ApplicationServices.EnableMainWindowPlacementSaveAndRestore
member.summary: Enables the main window position save and restore. This will happen automatically unless you access the ApplicationServices before your main window is constructed. If so, call this method after your MainWindow was constructed to enable position saving.

member.name: P:Keysight.Aes.Asf.Applications.ApplicationServices.GlobalSettings
member.summary: Gets or sets the global settings.

member.name: P:Keysight.Aes.Asf.Applications.ApplicationServices.GlobalInformation
member.summary: This storage can be used for information that is accessed throughout the entire application. It only persists at runtime and there are no automated means of saving or loading this data.

member.name: E:Keysight.Aes.Asf.Applications.ApplicationServices.ShutdownRequestedChanged
member.summary: Event is fired whenever IsShutdownRequested changes. The sender will be null and the argument will be the current state.

member.name: E:Keysight.Aes.Asf.Applications.ApplicationServices.ProcessStopRequestedChanged
member.summary: Event is fired whenever IsProcessStopRequested changes. The sender will be null and the argument will be the current state.

member.name: P:Keysight.Aes.Asf.Applications.ApplicationServices.IsShutdownRequested
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the whole application is supposed to shutdown. For example, a QUIT button in a UI may cause this and any class may decide to no longer provide certain services but throw an exception instead.

member.name: P:Keysight.Aes.Asf.Applications.ApplicationServices.IsProcessStopRequested
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the current process is supposed to shutdown. For example, a STOP button in a UI may cause this and any class may decide to no longer provide certain services but throw an exception instead.

member.name: P:Keysight.Aes.Asf.Applications.ApplicationServices.IsAnyBreakRequested
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether any of the break requests IsShutdownRequested or IsProcessStopRequested was set.
member.value: true if this object is any break requested, false if not.

member.name: F:Keysight.Aes.Asf.Applications.ApplicationServices.InternalError
member.summary: Informs the user about an internal error and also logs it. When marked as fatal, an ApplicationException is thrown. Use error codes starting with E_ followed by your class name capital letters and an abbreviation that can be searched for in the source code. For example if a "Setup" property is null that should have been set by the consuming code of your class called "XmlSetupReader", your error code would be "E_XSR_SNS" (SND for "Setup Not Set"). Make sure that you don't use duplicate error codes.

member.name: F:Keysight.Aes.Asf.Applications.ApplicationServices.DialogWindowProvider
member.summary: A custom dialog window provider. You can use this to provide a different hosting window for dialogs that are automatically brought up, for example in a ExpertSolution environment, the SolutionConfiguration dialog will be hosted in what is returned here.
member.example:
If your application uses WSL, you want to change this to:
ApplicationServices.DialogWindowProvider = (() => { return new WslDialog(); });

member.name: F:Keysight.Aes.Asf.Applications.ApplicationServices.RegularWindowProvider
member.summary: A custom regular window provider. You can use this to provide a different hosting window for regular windows that are supposed to stay open, like a document window. For example in a ExpertSolution environment, loading a previously saved measurement will be hosted in what is returned here.
member.example:
If your application uses WSL, you want to change this to:
ApplicationServices.DialogWindowProvider = (() => { return new WslMainWindow(); });

member.name: T:Keysight.Aes.Asf.Applications.AppSettings
member.summary:
Helper methods to simplify the load and save operations for settings or configuration files within the AppData/Roaming space.
All files are serialized to and saved as UTF8 encoded XML.
The actual file operations can be redirected via the dependency injection hooks in the ApplicationServices.

member.name: M:Keysight.Aes.Asf.Applications.AppSettings.SaveDefaultSettings(System.String,System.Object)
member.summary: Saves a serialized class instance as the default settings within a particular Domain.
member.param: The relative path of folder names, e.g. "CompanyName\\ ApplicationName". If any of the folders does not exist, it is created.
The class instance to serialize and store.
member.returns: The full path of the default settings file.

member.name: M:Keysight.Aes.Asf.Applications.AppSettings.SaveSettings(System.String,System.Object)
member.summary: Saves a serialized class instance as an xml settings file within a particular Domain. This tries to automatically determine the file name from the type to save, hence the type must have the StorageName attribute attached.
member.exception: Thrown when one or more arguments have unsupported or illegal values.
member.param: The relative path of folder names, e.g. "CompanyName\\ ApplicationName". If any of the folders does not exist, it is created.
The class instance to serialize and store.
member.returns: The full path of the default settings file.

member.name: M:Keysight.Aes.Asf.Applications.AppSettings.SaveSettings(System.String,System.String,System.Object)
member.summary: Saves a serialized class instance as an xml settings file within a particular Domain.
member.param: The relative path of folder names, e.g. "CompanyName\\ ApplicationName". If any of the folders does not exist, it is created.
Filename of the file. No check is done on whether the file exists.
The class instance to serialize and store.
member.returns: The full path of the default settings file.

member.summary: Loads the default settings from a particular domain as an instance of a particular type.

true to forward exceptions, otherwise they will only be logged and null is returned.
member.returns: The default settings or null if no settings exist.

member.name: M:Keysight.Aes.Asf.Applications.AppSettings.LoadSettings``1(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Loads a settings class from a particular domain as an instance of a particular type. This tries to automatically determine the file name from the type to load, hence the type must have the StorageName attribute attached.
member.exception: Thrown when one or more arguments have unsupported or illegal values.
member.param: The relative path of folder names, e.g. "CompanyName\\ ApplicationName". If any of the folders does not exist, it is created.
true to forward exceptions, otherwise they will only be logged and null is returned.
member.returns: The default settings or null if no settings exist.

member.summary: Loads a settings class from a particular domain as an instance of a particular type.
member.param: The relative path of folder names, e.g. "CompanyName\\ ApplicationName". If any of the folders does not exist, it is created.
Filename of the file. No check is done on whether the file exists.
(Optional) true to forward exceptions, otherwise they will only be logged and null is returned.

member.name: T:Keysight.Aes.Asf.Applications.Assemblies
member.summary: Contains various methods to help load assemblies from various locations.

member.name: M:Keysight.Aes.Asf.Applications.Assemblies.GetExecutableLocation
member.summary: Gets the location of the executable file that started the current task.
member.returns: The executable location.

member.name: M:Keysight.Aes.Asf.Applications.Assemblies.LoadAllReferencedAssemblies(System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Loads all referenced assemblies that have not been loaded yet. Note that the compiler may remove assembly references if no code is used at compile time. You have to manually load such an assembly or use a dummy call or type within such an assembly.
member.param: true to ignore all assemblies in the System namespace and start the search from the entry assembly.

member.name: M:Keysight.Aes.Asf.Applications.Assemblies.LoadReferencedAssemblies(System.Reflection.Assembly,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Loads all the assemblies referenced by another assembly that have not been loaded yet. Note that the compiler may remove assembly references if no code is used at compile time. You have to manually load such an assembly or use a dummy call or type within such an assembly.
member.param: true to ignore all assemblies in the System namespace.

member.name: M:Keysight.Aes.Asf.Applications.Assemblies.LoadAssembliesFrom(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Loads all assemblies from a certain directory. All files ending in .dll are treated as possible assemblies and a load attempt is performed. Failed attempts are logged to the Asf.Applications.Logger as warnings and loading is continued.
member.param: Full pathname of the directory to search for assemblies. If the directory does not exist, a log entry is created and the method returns 0.
member.returns: The number of assemblies successfully loaded from the directory.

member.name: T:Keysight.Aes.Asf.Applications.ConfigFile
member.summary: Read and writes configuration files where each line is stored in the "Key=Value" format. For each key, multiple entries are allowed. Use GetConfigValue() to retrieve the first entry, use GetAllConfigValues() or GetFirst/NextConfigValue() to retrieve additional ones.

member.name: F:Keysight.Aes.Asf.Applications.ConfigFile.C_COMMENT_CHARS
member.summary: Accepted characters at the line beginning that indicate a remark

member.name: P:Keysight.Aes.Asf.Applications.ConfigFile.Count
member.summary: The number of entries in the config file

member.name: M:Keysight.Aes.Asf.Applications.ConfigFile.CountKeys(System.String)
member.summary: The number of entries for a certain key

member.name: M:Keysight.Aes.Asf.Applications.ConfigFile.ContainsKey(System.String)
member.summary: Check if a certain key is present in the config file.
member.returns: true if at least one entry is present.

member.name: T:Keysight.Aes.Asf.Applications.ConfigFile.StringPairs
member.summary: An internal helper class that holds all the key value pairs in the config file. A regular dictionary doesn't work since we allow multiple key entries.

member.name: M:Keysight.Aes.Asf.Applications.ConfigFile.#ctor
member.summary: Creates a new empty config file with no physical file location attached. You need to call SaveConfigAs() to associate this instance with a file on disk.

member.name: M:Keysight.Aes.Asf.Applications.ConfigFile.FromString(System.String)
member.summary: Initializes this object from the given config file contents. Those may be read e.g. from a database or file. Note that no physical file location is attached to the newly created instance. You need to call SaveConfigAs() to associate this instance with a file on disk.
member.returns: A ConfigFile.

member.name: M:Keysight.Aes.Asf.Applications.ConfigFile.FromFile(System.String)
member.summary: Initializes this object from the given file and associates it with the physical file location. If the file does not exist yet, it will be created once you call SaveConfig(). Note that any comments or blank lines are lost if you later save the file to the same location.
member.param: The file to load the config from. Each line must be in the format "Key=Value".
member.returns: A ConfigFile.

member.name: M:Keysight.Aes.Asf.Applications.ConfigFile.SaveConfig
member.summary: Saves the configuration to a file that must have previously been associated by either calling SaveConfigAs() or initially instantiating the config file with FromFile().
member.exception: Thrown when no file was yet associated.

member.name: M:Keysight.Aes.Asf.Applications.ConfigFile.SaveConfigAs(System.String)
member.summary: Saves the configuration in the given location. The caller must be aware of any exceptions that may occur due to illegal path syntax, missing access rights etc.

member.name: M:Keysight.Aes.Asf.Applications.ConfigFile.CreateConfigString
member.summary: Creates a string containing the configuration. This string may be saved to a file or database.
member.returns: The new configuration string.

member.name: M:Keysight.Aes.Asf.Applications.ConfigFile.SetConfigValue(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Will set (or create) the entry for the given key. If multiple entries for this key do already exist, only the first occurrence is overwritten. Note that an empty string can be set as a value. If configValue is null however, the key will be removed from the config. If multiple entries exist, all of them will be removed.
member.param: The key of the config entry.

member.name: M:Keysight.Aes.Asf.Applications.ConfigFile.DeleteConfigValue(System.String)
member.summary: Deletes the config entry. If multiple entries exist, all of them are removed. If no entry with the given key exists, the function will return without further notice.
member.param: The key of the config entry.

member.name: M:Keysight.Aes.Asf.Applications.ConfigFile.GetConfigValue(System.String)
member.summary: Gets the configuration value. If multiple entries exist, the first occurrence is returned.
member.param: The key of the config entry.
member.returns: The configuration value.

member.name: M:Keysight.Aes.Asf.Applications.ConfigFile.GetAllConfigValues(System.String)
member.summary: Gets all configuration values for a certain key.
member.param: The key of the config entry.
member.returns: A list of configuration values. If the key does not exist, an empty list is returned.

member.name: M:Keysight.Aes.Asf.Applications.ConfigFile.GetFirstConfigValue(System.String)
member.summary: Gets the configuration value for the first occurrence of a key.
member.param: The key of the config entry.
member.returns: The first configuration value or null if the key does not exist.

member.name: M:Keysight.Aes.Asf.Applications.ConfigFile.GetNextConfigValue(System.String)
member.summary: Gets the next configuration value for the key.
member.param: The key of the config entry.
member.returns: The next configuration value or null if no further entries do exist.

member.name: M:Keysight.Aes.Asf.Applications.ConfigFile.GetBooleanValue(System.String)
member.summary: Returns true, if the entry exists and is set to "true" (non-case sensitive) Returns false, if the entry exists and is set to "false" (non-case sensitive) Returns null if the key does not exist or the value is not boolean
member.param: The key of the config entry.
member.returns: The entry's value or null

member.name: M:Keysight.Aes.Asf.Applications.ConfigFile.GetBooleanValue(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Returns true, if the entry exists and is set to "true" (non-case sensitive) Returns false, if the entry exists and is set to "false" (non-case sensitive) Returns the "missingValue" if the key does not exist or the value is not boolean
member.param: The key of the config entry.
member.returns: true if it succeeds, false if it fails.

member.name: M:Keysight.Aes.Asf.Applications.ConfigFile.GetFirstKeyValuePair
member.summary: Gets the first key value pair from the config file.

member.name: M:Keysight.Aes.Asf.Applications.ConfigFile.GetNextKeyValuePair
member.summary: Gets the next key value pair.
member.returns: The next key value pair or null if no more entries exist.

member.name: T:Keysight.Aes.Asf.Applications.AppVersion
member.summary: Contains helper methods to retrieve the applications version and build date.

member.name: M:Keysight.Aes.Asf.Applications.AppVersion.GetVersionString(System.Boolean,System.Reflection.Assembly)
member.summary:
Gets the application version and build date as a string in the form of "1.2 (17.3.2017)" or "1.2.4.8" if the AssemblyInfo isn't set up for build dates. Note that you have to adjust your AssemblyInfo.cs and change
[assembly: AssemblyVersion("1.0.0.0")]
to
[assembly: AssemblyVersion("1.0.*")]
to have the build date automatically written into the application version info on each compile run.
member.param: True to include, false to exclude the exact build date.
The assembly to get the version string for or null to use the entry assembly.
member.returns: The application version and perhaps the build date as a string.

member.name: M:Keysight.Aes.Asf.Applications.AppVersion.GetCopyrightString(System.Reflection.Assembly)
member.summary:
Gets a copyright string like " Keysight Technologies 2017" if the AssemblyInfo is set up for build dates. Note that you have to adjust your AssemblyInfo.cs and change
[assembly: AssemblyVersion("1.0.0.0")]
to
[assembly: AssemblyVersion("1.0.*")]
member.param: The assembly to get the version string for or null to use the entry assembly.
member.returns: The copyright string.

member.name: M:Keysight.Aes.Asf.Applications.AppVersion.GetCopyrightDate(System.Reflection.Assembly)
member.summary: Gets the copyright date based on the application build date.
member.param: The assembly to get the version string for or null to use the entry assembly.

member.summary: Gets application version of the executable initially launched.

member.returns: The application version.

member.summary:

[assembly: AssemblyVersion("1.0.0.0")]
to
[assembly: AssemblyVersion("1.0.*")]
to have the build date automatically written into the application version info on each compile run.
member.param: The assembly to get the version string for or null to use the entry assembly.
member.returns: The application build date.

member.name: M:Keysight.Aes.Asf.Applications.AppVersion.GetApplicationBuildDate(System.Version)
member.summary:
Gets the application build date from a version info that is supposed to contain that information. Note that you have to adjust your AssemblyInfo.cs and change

to
[assembly: AssemblyVersion("1.0.*")]
to have the build date automatically written into the application version info on each compile run.

member.summary: Class containing helper functions for catching exceptions.

member.name: M:Keysight.Aes.Asf.Applications.UnhandledExceptions.Catch(System.Object,System.Windows.Threading.DispatcherUnhandledExceptionEventArgs)
member.summary: Catches an unhandled exception, writes the stack trace and all inner exceptions to a logfile (you can configure the Target in Logger.LogFileName) and informs the user to pass this on to the developer.

In a WPF application, you would assign this in your MainWindow constructor.
this.Dispatcher.UnhandledException += Asf.Applications.UnhandledExceptions.Catch;

member.name: T:Keysight.Aes.Asf.DataCollections.SettingsStorage
member.summary: Keeps a component collection of settings classes that can be saved / loaded and accessed through type template methods. The ApplicationServices hold an instance of this by default (called GlobalSettings) which has pre-populated settings like the CsvExportSettings. If you want to make use of these, you need to assign the SettingsFolder and call LoadSettings() once. SaveSettings() is called automatically through the ApplicationExit event.(EXS will take care of that for you)

member.name: T:Keysight.Aes.Asf.DataCollections.CollectorIgnoreAttribute
member.summary: Attribute to decorate all public properties that shall NOT be collected from a data class.

member.name: T:Keysight.Aes.Asf.DataCollections.Collector`1
member.summary:
A collector class will collect data that arrives in rows and will rearrange it to columns identified by name. Examples include data classes that hold data by properties. The properties need to be public instance members and need to be decorated with the CollectibleAttribute.
It's also possible to just collect single values, in which case two columns will automatically be generated, one holding the values and one holding an increasing index starting at zero.
The Collector can be strongly typed or, by using the generic object type for T, it can allow for different types per column. The data can then be retrieved via GetCastData to receive typed data.
While adding data, it is not required that all columns maintain the same data count and the collector does not test for this. However particular extraction methods may require an identical count across all columns, e.g. ToDataTable() and will cause an exception if the requirement isn't met.
When adding data, it is not required that all data within a column is of the same type unless the collector was instantiated in a strongly typed manner (e.g. Collector<double>).
member.typeparam: Generic type parameter to be used for the data elements.

member.summary: The name of an automatically generated index column if Add(IEnumerable) was used.

member.name: F:Keysight.Aes.Asf.DataCollections.Collector`1.C_VALUE_COLUMN
member.summary: The name of an automatically generated value column if Add(IEnumerable) was used.

member.summary: Adds all values and indices of the provided lists to automatically generated columns. The exact column names can be determined via the constants C_VALUE_COLUMN and C_INDEX_COLUMN. Since the indices and the values are of the same types, you may to create the Collector instance as Collector>double< to use this method.
member.exception: Thrown when the two collections vary in size.

member.param: The class instance to add the data from.

member.summary: Adds all values of the provided list to a value column and automatically generates or continues an index column. The exact column names can be determined via the constants C_VALUE_COLUMN and C_INDEX_COLUMN. Since the index and the values are of different types, you need to create the Collector instance as Collector>object< to use this method.

members.member:
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Query if the model number from the IDN reply matches any of the given model numbers. The comparison is case sensitive. Optionally, wildcards can be used, e.g "344*A" for all DMMs or "3446?A" for a few very particular models. In Demo mode, assume that the instrument is correct
Gumoreau, 11/21/2017.
The model numbers. (Optional) True to allow, false to deny wildcards.
True if instrument allowed, false if not. -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

member.name: T:Keysight.Aes.Asf.Instruments.InstrumentSearch
member.summary:
This class is design to look for every instrument available for connection. use DiscoverInstrument() to broadcast on the port 111 and get all the instrument answers. Please find a description of the main functions :
_DiscoverInstrument() is used to refresh the broadcast, and get a dictionary of all the "*IDN?"/Ip address of every instrument available.
_RetreiveMatchingIPVisaAddress(string instrumentName) is used to retrieve a list of IP Visa address that are matching you request.
_RetrieveMatchingHostNameVisaAddress(string instrumentName) is used to retrieve a list of HostName Visa address that are matching you request.
_RetrieveMatchingHostNameLocalVisaAddress(string instrumentName) is used to retrieve a list of local HostName Visa address that are matching you request.

member.name: F:Keysight.Aes.Asf.Instruments.InstrumentSearch.C_INSTRUMENT_TIMEOUT_MS
member.summary: the query instrument timeout in ms.

member.name: F:Keysight.Aes.Asf.Instruments.InstrumentSearch.C_BROADCAST_TIMEOUT_MS
member.summary: the broadcast timeout in ms.

members.member:
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Discover instrument while broadcasting on the '255.255.255.255' address. Is used as a refresh. can also broadcast on every adapter address present on the computer by setting BroadcastAdapterLocalAddress to true.
(Optional) Enable the broadcast on all the adapter local address (Lan and Wifi) (Optional) True to look for visa.
A Dictionary with the instrument IDN and IP address found ; -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Create a list of Hostname Visa Address that match the instrument request. The Hostname are built according to the default instrument Hostname. EX : TCPIP0::K-PA2201A-00158::inst0::INSTR 'K' stand for Keysight, 'PA2201A' is the instrument name , '00158' is the last 5 digit of the Serial Number. if you are in a local network without DHCP, please use RetrieveMatchingHostNameLocal() instead.
type of the instrument.
A List of Hostname Visa address that match the instrument name specified -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Create a list of Hostname Visa Address that match the instrument request. The Hostname are built according to the default instrument Hostname. EX : TCPIP0::K-PA2201A-00158::inst0::INSTR 'K' stand for Keysight, 'PA2201A' is the instrument name , '00158' is the last 5 digit of the Serial Number. if you are in a network with DHCP, please use RetrieveMatchingHostName() instead.
type of the instrument you are looking for ex:"PA2201A" .
A List of Hostname local Visa address that match the instrument name specified -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Create a list of IP Visa address that match the instrument request
type of the instrument you are looking for. ex:"PA2201A"
A List of IP Visa address that match the instrument name specified; -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Searches in the DiscoveredList some instrument that are matching the instrumentName.
type of the instrument you are looking for ex:"PA2201A".
The found matching instrument. -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- Convert the list of all matched instrument visa address to a list of Hostname visa address.
The instrument visa address. True to local.
A list of maching instrument hostname. -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

member.name: T:Keysight.Aes.Asf.Instruments.InstrumentSearchHelper
member.summary: This class is a Helper using the InstrumentSearch class. see InstrumentSearchHelp.Search() for more info///

members.member:
------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- This method is design to look for every instrument available for connection.
It will first broadcast the network with the IP address 255.255.255.255, then query the IDN.
It will also try to connection with the default USB instrument "UsbInstrument1" and look in the configured Visa Address (with Connection Expert for example).
With this IDN, it will create the standard hostname Visa Address for this instrument
EX : TCPIP0::K-PA2201A-00158::inst0::INSTR
'K' stand for Keysight, 'PA2201A' is the instrument name , '00158' is the last 5 digit of the Serial Number.
you will receive a string list of matching instrument hostname.
You can set tryConnection to true to test every Address at the end before retrieving the result. it takes of course more time.
Type of the insutrment. (Optional) True to refresh the connection. (Optional) True to try connection.
A list of matching instrument hostname. -------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

member.name: T:Keysight.Aes.Asf.Instruments.IVisaFactory
member.summary: Interface to attempt to create instrument instances based on a certain Visa connection. If the actual instrument is unknown, all IVisaFactory providers can be iterated to see which one(s) return true. This saves us from performance issues if we would instead put the visa instrument into the constructor and would have to throw an exception on an instrument missmatch.

member.name: T:Keysight.Aes.Asf.Instruments.VisaInstrument
member.summary:
This is a part of the ScpiInstrument.cs from the TAP engine and the parser from Scpi.cs with a few extensions.
This excerpt does not presume a valid Scpi instrument and does not automatically attempt to talk to it. It can thus be used to talk to a 3458A or an older R2D2 instrument as well.
For example the IdnString property is only filled in once it's actually evaluated.

member.value: true if automatic connect, false if not.

member.name: P:Keysight.Aes.Asf.Instruments.VisaInstrument.IdnString
member.summary: Gets the instrument identity string as returned by the SCPI command "*IDN?", hence a proper Scpi instrument has to be connected. If the instrument was not yet opened, it will be opened. If the IdnString was retrieved successfully before, the (potentially obsolete) result will be returned. You may set the IdnString manually if you connect to a non-SCPI instrument like the 3458A.

member.name: P:Keysight.Aes.Asf.Instruments.VisaInstrument.IdnComponents
member.summary: Gets the four individual ID components as returned by the "*IDN?" command. If the IDN could not be queried, null is returned. If the instrument sends a reply, an array with exactly 4 entries will always be returned. If the instrument however does return less than 4 components, the missing entries are set to null.

member.name: P:Keysight.Aes.Asf.Instruments.VisaInstrument.IdnManufacturer
member.summary: Gets the manufacturer part from the IDN components.
member.value: The manufacturer or null if the IDN query failed.

member.summary: Gets the model number part from the IDN components.
member.value: The model number or null if the IDN query failed.

member.summary: Gets the serial number part from the IDN components.

member.summary: Gets the software version part from the IDN components.
member.value: The software version or null if the IDN query failed.

member.summary: A list of known manufacturers in an *IDN? response.

member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether the manufacturer returned in the IDN query is among the known ones.
member.value: true if the manufacturer is known, false if not.

member.name: M:Keysight.Aes.Asf.Instruments.VisaInstrument.IsModelNumber(System.String[],System.Boolean)
member.summary: Query if the model number from the IDN reply matches any of the given model numbers. The comparison is case sensitive. Optionally, wildcards can be used, e.g "344*A" for all DMMs or "3446?A" for a few very particular models.
member.param: true to allow "?" and "*" wildcards in the model numbers.
member.returns: true if the actual model number matches any of the given strings, false if not.

members.member:
Query if the instrument version is (at least) a certain revision. For each fragment of the version, the value will be compared if both cues render as integers, otherwise the alphabetical order will be compared.
The version cue, for example "D.01.02". true to also accept later versions.
true if the instrument software version is equal or higher, false if not.
### Thrown when the passed in cue has more fragments than the instrument version info.

member.name: T:Keysight.Aes.Asf.Maths.Interpolation
member.summary: Provides various methods to interpolate on data points.

member.name: M:Keysight.Aes.Asf.Maths.Interpolation.Lerp(System.Double,System.Double[0:,0:])
member.summary: Takes an index and a table that projects an index onto a value. The two closest index entries are used to perform a linear interpolation. If the index is outside the bounds of the table, the border value will be returned.
member.returns: The interpolated value.

member.name: M:Keysight.Aes.Asf.Maths.Interpolation.Lerp(System.Double,System.Double,System.Double)
member.summary: Linearly interpolates between two values. For a fraction of 0, value A is returned, for a fraction of 1, value B is returned. For a fraction between 0 and 1, a linearly interpolated value between A and B is returned. For a fraction outside the [0 1] interval, an appropriately interpolated value is returned that would also sit on the line crossing A and B.
member.returns: The interpolated value.

member.name: T:Keysight.Aes.Asf.Maths.PolyCurveFit
member.summary: This class was taken from the Truss code base. The location for this code base is $/MPO/Core/trunk/software/src/ModularCore/DspLib/Dsp.cs

member.name: M:Keysight.Aes.Asf.Maths.PolyCurveFit.PolyFit(System.Double[],System.Double[],System.Int32,System.Int32,System.Double[])
member.summary: Fits a polynomial to a set of real data.
member.param: The array of real data to be fit.
The value of the independent variable
The number of terms in the polynomial used to fit the data.
The power of the independent variable in the first, lowest power, term.
A weighting function for the squared deviation of each data sample.
member.returns: The polynomial coefficients, starting at the lowest power, p0.
member.remarks: The weight parameter is optional. Set it to null to achieve a uniform weighting of each data sample. The length of weight should match the data array. If it does not, extra values are ignored. Missing values are assumed to have a weight of zero.

member.name: T:Keysight.Aes.Asf.Maths.Aggregate
member.summary: Provides various methods to extract or reduce sets of data. Extraction is done by building groups of data, for example to reduce a set of 100 entries to a set of 5, the set is grouped into 5 groups, each containing 20 numbers. From each group, a final number is derived by choosing one of various available of the following methods. For non-matching subset dividers, error diffusion is applied. I.e. if a subset of size 6 is requested from a set of 26, the derived groups are of the sizes 4,5,4,4,5,4 (instead of accumulating the error in the last group which would lead to group sizes 4,4,4,4,4,6).

member.name: T:Keysight.Aes.Asf.Maths.Aggregate.AggregateMethods
member.summary: Specifies the various ways in which a subset of data can be extracted from a superset.

member.name: F:Keysight.Aes.Asf.Maths.Aggregate.AggregateMethods.First
member.summary: Returns the first number of a group

member.name: F:Keysight.Aes.Asf.Maths.Aggregate.AggregateMethods.Average
member.summary: Returns the average of a group

member.name: F:Keysight.Aes.Asf.Maths.Aggregate.AggregateMethods.RMS
member.summary: Returns the root mean square of a group

member.name: F:Keysight.Aes.Asf.Maths.Aggregate.AggregateMethods.MinimumPeak
member.summary: Returns the minimum value of the group. Keep in mind that this may be a negative number.

member.name: F:Keysight.Aes.Asf.Maths.Aggregate.AggregateMethods.MaximumPeak
member.summary: Returns the maximum value of the group. Keep in mind that this may be a negative number if the whole group is negative and that the absolute value will then be the smallest of the group.

member.name: F:Keysight.Aes.Asf.Maths.Aggregate.AggregateMethods.MinMaxPeak
member.summary: Returns the value that's the furthest apart from zero but includes the sign.

member.name: F:Keysight.Aes.Asf.Maths.Aggregate.AggregateMethods.AbsPeak
member.summary: Returns the value that's the furthest apart from zero without the sign.

member.summary: Returns a subset of a certain size from the provided data, using the specified method. If the requested amount of data is larger than the provided amount, only the provided data is returned. If the provided data is null, null is returned.

member.name: T:Keysight.Aes.Asf.MVVM.Converters.BrushOpacityConverter
member.summary:
A brush opacity converter.
Define one in your resources for each opacity value you want to use.
xmlns:conv="clr-namespace:ASF.MVVM.Converters;assembly=Keysight.Aes.Asf"
<UserControl.Resources> <conv:BrushOpacityConverter x:Key="OpacityConverter" Opacity="0.6"/> </UserControl.Resources>
Use with a named or resource defined brush like
<Setter Property="Background" Value="{Binding Source={StaticResource BackgroundProxy}, Path=Data, Converter={StaticResource OpacityConverter}}"/>

member.name: T:Keysight.Aes.Asf.MVVM.Converters.ObjectToObjectConverter
member.summary: A generic object to object converter.
member.example:
This example shows how to map the entries of an enum to brushes in a ResourceDictionary. The example enum is of Type 'DataProcessorTypes' found in namespace 'vm'. The following namespace declarations need to be made, e.g. in the UserControl XAML header. The "vm" would point to your particular viewmodel namespace (or can be omitted if that's the same as the view).
xmlns:vm="clr-namespace:ExpUI.WhiteboardItems.ViewModels" xmlns:asf="clr-namespace:Keysight.Aes.Asf.MVVM.Converters"
This part goes to the resource section, e.g. of your UserControl or you could put this in a ResourceDictionary as well.
<asf:ObjectToObjectConverter x:Key="ProcessorTypeToBrightConverter"> <asf:ObjectToObjectConverter.MapItems> <asf:MapItem Source = "{x:Static vm:DataProcessorTypes.DataSource}" Target="{StaticResource DataSourceBrightBack}"/> <asf:MapItem Source = "{x:Static vm:DataProcessorTypes.DataProcessor}" Target="{StaticResource DataProcessorBrightBack}"/> <asf:MapItem Source = "{x:Static vm:DataProcessorTypes.DataTarget}" Target="{StaticResource DataTargetBrightBack}"/> </asf:ObjectToObjectConverter.MapItems> </asf:ObjectToObjectConverter>

member.name: T:Keysight.Aes.Asf.MVVM.BindingProxy
member.summary: A binding proxy allows you to indirectly bind the Source of a Binding to a Dynamic Resource.
member.example:
Declare the proxy in your resources, using your DynamicResource as Data.
<UserControl.Resources> <asf:BindingProxy x:Key="BackgroundProxy" Data="{DynamicResource MyDynamicBackgroundResource}"/> </UserControl.Resources>
You can then assign your Proxy to the Source of a Binding
<Setter Property="Background" Value="{Binding Source={StaticResource BackgroundProxy}, Path=Data, Converter={StaticResource OpacityConverter}}"/>

member.name: T:Keysight.Aes.Asf.MVVM.VisualTreeUtil
member.summary: Utility functions for the visual tree.

member.name: M:Keysight.Aes.Asf.MVVM.VisualTreeUtil.GetVisualParent``1(System.Windows.DependencyObject)
member.summary: Iterates up the visual tree of an element until it finds a parent object of the given type. You can also use this on a HitTest result, since this will return individual elements when you may want to get the containing user control.
member.example: Here, a UserControl called DataConnector is wanted, contained in other UserControls within a Canvas
member.code: HitTestResult result = VisualTreeHelper.HitTest(WhiteboardArea, point); DataConnector connector = VisualTreeUtil.GetVisualParent<DataConnector>(result.VisualHit);
member.param: The element from which to start the upwards search.
member.returns: The visual control of the requested type or null.

member.name: M:Keysight.Aes.Asf.MVVM.VisualTreeUtil.GetDataContextParent``1(System.Windows.DependencyObject)
member.summary: Iterates up the visual tree of an element until it finds a parent object that has a DataContext of the given type. You can also use this on a HitTest result, since this will return individual elements when you may want to get the containing user control.
member.typeparam: The type of the required DataContext.
member.param: The element from which to start the upwards search.
member.returns: The visual control holding a DataContext of the requested type or null.

member.name: M:Keysight.Aes.Asf.MVVM.VisualTreeUtil.HitTest``1(System.Windows.Media.Visual,System.Windows.Point)
member.summary: Determines if the item that has been hit is of a particular type or is contained (at any hierarchy level) within a parent object of that type.
member.returns: The visual control of the requested type or null.

member.summary: Searches for the first visual child by name.
member.returns: The found visual child by name.

member.summary: Finds all the visual children of a particular type in this control.

member.name: T:Keysight.Aes.Asf.Network.BTP.BtpConnection
member.summary: The Block Transfer Protocol sends and receives complete blocks of binary data by simply adding a size information upfront. This allows you to send deterministic data junks across a TCP connection without worrying about packets being split up on the network. The 32 unsigned integer size information is transferred as a 4 byte little endian value.
member.example: See Keysight.Aes.Asf.IntegrationTests for a usage example

member.name: F:Keysight.Aes.Asf.Network.BTP.BtpConnection.C_BTP_PORT
member.summary: The default BTP port.

member.summary: The number of bytes that is used to send the size of the actual data packet.

member.name: F:Keysight.Aes.Asf.Network.BTP.BtpConnection.ReceiveProgressEvent
member.summary: The receive progress event. Occurs every time new data is received upon a call to Receive().

member.name: F:Keysight.Aes.Asf.Network.BTP.BtpConnection.SendProgressEvent
member.summary: The send progress event. Occurs every time data was handed over to the TCP/IP stack upon a call to Send().

member.summary: Attribute to ignore a property on compare.

member.summary: Allows for the generic comparison of all public properties in individual class instances.

member.name: F:Keysight.Aes.Asf.Reflection.Comparer.C_ARE_EQUAL
member.summary: The value returned by a comparison function in case the first operand equals the second.

member.name: F:Keysight.Aes.Asf.Reflection.Comparer.C_ARE_NOT_EQUAL
member.summary: The value returned by a comparison function in case the first operand differs from the second.

member.name: M:Keysight.Aes.Asf.Reflection.Comparer.CompareProperties``1(``0,``0)
member.summary: Compares the public properties of two class instances. If a property type implements the IComparable interface, it is used and for uneven values, the result of the comparer is returned.
member.typeparam: Generic type parameter, must be a class.
member.returns: C_ARE_EQUAL if all properties are equal or both class references are null C_ARE_NOT_EQUAL if one class is null while the other is not C_ARE_NOT_EQUAL if a property is encountered that differs between A and B and does not implement IComparable Otherwise the IComparable.Compare() result for the first non matching pair of properties

member.name: M:Keysight.Aes.Asf.Reflection.Comparer.Compare(System.Object,System.Object)
member.summary: Compares two objects.
member.returns: C_ARE_EQUAL if both objects are null C_ARE_NOT_EQUAL if the objects are of different types or one is null while the other is not C_ARE_NOT_EQUAL if the type does not implement IComparable and the objects are considered not equal by the equality operator ("==") Otherwise the result of the IComparable implementation.

member.name: T:Keysight.Aes.Asf.Text.Parsers.LabelUnitSplitter
member.summary: Provides helper methods to extract units from labels.

member.name: M:Keysight.Aes.Asf.Text.Parsers.LabelUnitSplitter.SplitUnit(System.String)
member.summary: Splits a label formatted like "Name [Unit]" into the name and unit. If no brackets are found (this includes the label being null or an empty string), the returned unit is an empty string. If multiple brackets exist, only the last pair is considered to hold the unit. If there is text beyond the final bracket pair it will be lost.
member.returns: The unit.

member.name: M:Keysight.Aes.Asf.Text.Parsers.LabelUnitSplitter.SplitName(System.String)
member.summary: Splits a label formatted like "Name [Unit]" into the name and unit. If no brackets are found (this includes the label being null or an empty string), the returned unit is an empty string. The returned name is also an empty string if the provided label is null or empty. If multiple brackets exist, only the last pair is considered to hold the unit and will be removed. All other brackets will become part of the returned name. If there is text beyond the final bracket pair it will be lost.
member.returns: The unit.

member.name: M:Keysight.Aes.Asf.Text.Parsers.LabelUnitSplitter.SplitNameUnit(System.String)
member.summary: Splits a label formatted like "Name [Unit]" into the name and unit. If no brackets are found (this includes the label being null or an empty string), the returned unit is an empty string. The returned name is also an empty string if the provided label is null or empty. If multiple brackets exist, only the last pair is considered to hold the unit. All other brackets will become part of the returned name. If there is text beyond the final bracket pair it will be lost.
member.returns: A string[2] with the name at index 0 and the unit at index 1.

member.name: M:Keysight.Aes.Asf.Text.Parsers.LabelUnitSplitter.IsEngineeringUnit(System.String)
member.summary: Query if 'unit' looks like an engineering unit that can be prefixed with "k", "m", "" etc. For example, this is true for "V", "A" but not for "C" or "A".
member.returns: true if engineering unit, false if not.

member.name: T:Keysight.Aes.Asf.Text.Parsers.NumberUnitSplitter
member.summary: A number unit splitter can split a text into numbers and units using whitespaces and changes from digits to characters as splitting points.

member.name: M:Keysight.Aes.Asf.Text.Parsers.NumberUnitSplitter.Split(System.String,System.Globalization.NumberStyles,System.Globalization.CultureInfo)
member.summary: Splits a string into pairs of numbers and units. The units are not evaluated in any way but just returned as strings. Separation points are whitespaces, any switch from digits to characters and vice versa. Dots, commas etc. are considered to belong to numbers, also the character 'e' when it is followed by a sign or digit. You can provide parsing parameters though that may render such a number invalid. For empty input strings, an empty list is returned. In case of invalid numbers, an FormatException is thrown.
member.param: The accepted styles for number parsing.
The culture for number parsing. If omitted, DefaultThreadCurrentCulture is chosen.
member.returns: A List<Tuple<double,string>>

member.name: M:Keysight.Aes.Asf.Text.Parsers.NumberUnitSplitter.Split(System.String,System.Double@,System.String@,System.Globalization.NumberStyles,System.Globalization.CultureInfo)
member.summary: Splits a string into a value and a unit. If no valid value input is found, false is returned If no unit is found, parseValue returns the double.Parse() result and unitString is empty. If a unit is found, it is returned with stripped leading or trailing blanks.
member.param: The accepted styles for number parsing.
The culture for number parsing. If omitted, the DefaultThreadCurrentCulture is chosen.
member.returns: true if it succeeds to retrieve and parse at least a value, false if it fails.

member.name: M:Keysight.Aes.Asf.Text.Parsers.NumberUnitSplitter.GetLeadingDigits(System.String,System.Globalization.NumberStyles,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Retrieves the leading part of the string that contains digits only and an optional set of formatting signs. Note that the returned string may even consist of formatting signs only like ",.-+e+" so you should use the .NET type parser on the result determine if it is an actual number.
member.param: This can be configured to accept the features decimal delimiter, leading sign and exponent.
true to include leading white space characters.
member.returns: The leading digits.

member.name: T:Keysight.Aes.Asf.Text.Parsers.TimeSpanParser
member.summary: A time span parser can parse a text input (which would typically be a user input) for timespan information like "1 hour 2 minutes" or "1 week 250ms" and sum them all up into a TimeSpan. Currently only English units are supported.

member.name: M:Keysight.Aes.Asf.Text.Parsers.TimeSpanParser.Parse(System.String,System.Globalization.NumberStyles,System.Globalization.CultureInfo,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Parses a string for TimeSpan Information like "1 week 2 days" or "2h12m3s". Currently only English units are accepted. Note that "month" is not a valid unit, since it does not correspond to a determined number of days and so is "year" because of leap years. However you can have both units parsed to hardwired values using the parameter. Note that Microseconds are accepted, but the .NET TimeSpan only resolves milliseconds. Thus only multiples of thousands of Microseconds will affect the result, e.g. "2000s", when reformatted, will evaluate to "2ms" whereas "200s" will simply return TimeSpan.Zero.
member.exception: Thrown when one or more arguments have unsupported or illegal values.
Thrown when a unit is unknown.
member.param: The culture for number parsing. If omitted, DefaultThreadCurrentCulture is chosen.
true to accept months (as 30 days) and years (as 356 days).
member.returns: A TimeSpan.

member.name: T:Keysight.Aes.Asf.Text.Formatters.EngineeringFormatter
member.summary: Contains methods that support formatting to engineering standards, e.g. the exponent in multiples of three or in milli, micro etc. unit suffixes.

member.name: M:Keysight.Aes.Asf.Text.Formatters.EngineeringFormatter.GetEngineeringSuffix(System.Double@)
member.summary: Gets the engineering suffix and changes the value to the nearest multiple of e(+/-)3. Examples: 0.001 will be changed to 1 and will return "m" (for "milli"). 1234 will be changed to 1.234 and will return "k" (for "kilo"). 0.00045 will be changed to 45 and will return "" (for "micro"). 56789123.2 will be changed to 56.7891232 and will return "M" (for "Mega"). 1.234 will not be changed and will return "". 0 will not be changed and will return "".
member.returns: The engineering suffix.

member.name: M:Keysight.Aes.Asf.Text.Formatters.EngineeringFormatter.FormatToEngineeringSuffixSignificantDigits(System.Double,System.Int32,System.IFormatProvider,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Format a value to an engineering format with a number of significant digits. Examples: 1.234567 with 3 digits will return "1.23" 12345.67 with 4 digits will return "12.35k". 1234567.890 with 4 digits will return "1.235M". 0.00012 with 2 digits will return "120". 0.00012 with 4 digits will also return "120".
member.param: true to insert a white space between the number and the suffix.
member.returns: The formatted to significant digits.

member.name: M:Keysight.Aes.Asf.Text.Formatters.EngineeringFormatter.FormatToEngineeringExponentSignificantDigits(System.Double,System.Int32,System.IFormatProvider,System.String)
member.summary: Format a value to an engineering exponential format with a number of significant digits. Examples: 1.234567 with 3 digits will return "1.23" 12345.67 with 4 digits will return "12.35e3". 1234567.890 with 4 digits will return "1.235e6". 0.00012 with 2 digits will return "120e-6". 0.00012 with 4 digits will also return "120e-6".
member.returns: The formatted to significant digits.

member.name: M:Keysight.Aes.Asf.Text.Formatters.EngineeringFormatter.ShortLabel(System.Double)
member.summary: The default formatter for scale values. It will provide two decimal digits or one plus an exponent if the value is out of that range.
member.returns: A string.

member.exception: Thrown when one or more arguments have unsupported or illegal values.

The number of divisor ticks on the whole scale.
member.returns: The number formatted to an appropriate label.

member.name: M:Keysight.Aes.Asf.Text.Formatters.NumberFormatter.RequiredDigitsFormat(System.Double,System.Double,System.Double,System.Int32)

member.param: The value (may equal min or max).
The number of divisor ticks on the whole scale.

member.name: M:Keysight.Aes.Asf.Text.Formatters.NumberFormatter.GetLabelDelta(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Gets the delta between two values independently of the position of the delta. E.g. for "1.1" and "1.2" it will return 1 and for "1.01" and "1.02" also whereas "1.0020" and "1.0002" would return 18. The strings must be of equal length so for differing signs, you have to include both, e.g. "+1.2" and "-0.9"
member.exception: Thrown when one or more arguments have unsupported or illegal values.
member.returns: The label delta.

member.name: M:Keysight.Aes.Asf.Text.Formatters.NumberFormatter.GetDecimalDigits(System.Double)
member.summary: Gets the part of the number containing only the post-decimal-delimiter digits as a string.
member.returns: The decimal digits (without the delimiter). This is an empty string if the number is integral.

member.summary: Formats a timespan to a string like "3 min 4 sec".
member.param: true to insert a space before each unit.
true to include those parts of the timespan that are zero, starting with hours, e.g. "0h 2m 0s" instead of just "2m".
true to include, false to exclude the fractions of the second portion.
The Culture to use for number formatting. Since milliseconds are displayed as fractions of seconds, this effects the decimal delimiter. By default, the DefaultThreadCurrentCulture is used.
member.returns: The formatted value.

member.summary: Searches for the first edit control or category group within the whole UI tree that the reference control is part of and which matches the elementName. The search is performed on the Name of the FrameworkElements and assumes that the visual tree was originally created by the Populator.

[out] The value editor object (or label for read only presentations) if the found object was a property editor. Null if the found object was a Category group.

[out] The Expander control if the found object was a Category group, otherwise null.

member.name: M:Keysight.Aes.Asf.WPF.Common.Populator.CreateEditFields(System.Windows.Controls.Grid,System.Windows.Controls.Grid,System.Object)
member.summary: Creates labels and editable boxes to populate two columns represented by a label grid and a value grid. This is like a very primitive version of a PropertyGrid.
member.param: The grid holding the editable values.
The class holding the public properties for which to create editable controls for.
member.example:
Your XAML code to provide the two columns could look like this:
<Grid> <Grid.ColumnDefinitions > <ColumnDefinition Width = " Auto"/> <ColumnDefinition Width = "*" /> </Grid.ColumnDefinitions >
<Grid x:Name="LabelGrid" Grid.Row="1" Grid.Column="0"/> <Grid x:Name="ValueGrid" Grid.Row="1" Grid.Column="1"/> </Grid>

member.name: M:Keysight.Aes.Asf.WPF.Common.Populator.RunTriggerInitializers(System.Windows.DependencyObject)
member.summary: Executes the trigger initializers on all child controls that have a DisplayTrigger attached.

members.member:
Gets the contents of the edit fields created with CreateEditFields() and populates the public properties of a newly created class instance of type T. There is no checking on whether any of the filled in properties do exist in the class an vice versa. All extra data from the edit fields is simply ignored and all non-represented properties will keep their default values.
If there is invalid input, the fields will be marked in red and null is returned.
A class instance with populated properties or null in case one or more inputs could not be converted to the original type. In this case the corresponding input fields are marked in red and the user should be made aware of this.
### The StackPanel that contains all Grid with the properties.

member.name: M:Keysight.Aes.Asf.WPF.Common.Populator.GetEditFieldValues``1(System.Windows.Controls.Grid)
member.summary:
Gets the contents of the edit fields created with CreateEditFields() and populates the public properties of a newly created class instance of type T. There is no checking on whether any of the filled in properties do exist in the class an vice versa. All extra data from the edit fields is simply ignored and all non-represented properties will keep their default values.
If there is invalid input, the fields will be marked in red and null is returned.
member.param: The grid holding the editable values.
member.returns: A class instance with populated properties or null in case one or more inputs could not be converted to the original type. In this case the corresponding input fields are marked in red and the user should be made aware of this.

member.name: M:Keysight.Aes.Asf.WPF.Common.Populator.GetEditFieldValues(System.Object,System.Windows.Controls.StackPanel)
member.summary:
Gets the contents of the edit fields created with CreateEditFields() and populates the public properties of an existing class instance. There is no checking on whether any of the filled in properties do exist in the class an vice versa. All extra data from the edit fields is simply ignored and all non-represented properties will keep their default values.
If there is invalid input, the fields will be marked in red and null is returned.
member.param: The class holding the public properties which to fill in.
The StackPanel that contains all Grid with the properties.
member.returns: The passed in class instance filled in with the new values or null if there were parsing errors.

member.name: M:Keysight.Aes.Asf.WPF.Common.Populator.GetEditFieldValues(System.Object,System.Windows.Controls.Grid)
member.summary:
Gets the contents of the edit fields created with CreateEditFields() and populates the public properties of an existing class instance. All extra data from the edit fields is simply ignored and all non-represented properties will keep their default values.
If there is invalid input, the fields will be marked in red and null is returned.
member.param: The class holding the public properties which to fill in.
The grid holding the editable values.
member.returns: The passed in class instance filled in with the new values or null if there were parsing errors.

The destination value provided to the animation if the animation does not have its own destination value.
member.returns: The value this animation believes should be the current value for the property.

member.name: T:Keysight.Aes.Asf.WPF.Dialogs.DisplayTriggerActions
member.summary: The possible effects on a dependent category or property if the attributed property triggers.

member.name: F:Keysight.Aes.Asf.WPF.Dialogs.DisplayTriggerActions.Hide
member.summary: Hides the dependent object. For every non listed value, the dependent object will be shown.

member.name: F:Keysight.Aes.Asf.WPF.Dialogs.DisplayTriggerActions.Show
member.summary: Shows the dependent object. For every non listed value, the dependent object will be hidden.

member.name: F:Keysight.Aes.Asf.WPF.Dialogs.DisplayTriggerActions.Disable
member.summary: Disables the dependent object. For every non listed value, the dependent object will be enabled.

member.name: F:Keysight.Aes.Asf.WPF.Dialogs.DisplayTriggerActions.Enable
member.summary: Enables the dependent object. For every non listed value, the dependent object will be disabled.

member.name: T:Keysight.Aes.Asf.WPF.Dialogs.DisplayTriggerAttribute
member.summary: This attribute allows a boolean or enum property to modify the appearance (Visibility or Enabled) of another attribute or category created by the populator.
member.example:
Decorate a public property and reference the other property by name, the action it causes on the attributed property and the value on the referenced property that causes the action.
[DisplayName("Thermal Sensor Type")] [DisplayTrigger(nameof(AutocalIterations), DisplayTriggerActions.Enable, true)] public ThermalSensorTypes ThermalSensorType { get; set; } = ThermalSensorTypes.Unspecified;

member.summary: An indicator that can be layered on top of a plot that draws a vertical line with additional triangles at the top and bottom.

member.name: E:Keysight.Aes.Asf.WPF.Plotting.PlotIndicator.IndicatorChangeRequested
member.summary:
Invoked when the user clicked in the active area. The desired new position is given from 0.0 (far left) to 1.0 (far right) and it's up to the consumer to decide whether this (or another) value is fed back to the control's IndexerValue property.
If however IsChangeOnClick is set to true, this event is not fired and the IndexerValue is changed directly instead. The consumer can then bind or subscribe to the IndexerValue DependencyProperty.

member.name: P:Keysight.Aes.Asf.WPF.Plotting.PlotIndicator.IsChangingOnClick
member.summary: Determines whether the IndexerValue will automatically change to the appropriate position if the user clicks in a different area. When set to false, the IndicatorChangeRequested event is fired instead.
member.value: true if this object is changing on click, false if not.

member.summary: The indicator brush property.

member.name: T:Keysight.Aes.Asf.WPF.Plotting.PlotToolBox
member.summary:
A control that can be layered on top of one ore more VisualPlot controls. When hovering with the mouse, it will provide a tooltip and crosspoint highlite to give an exact readout of all the graphs at the mouse's X position. It also supports pan with the scrollwheel and zoom by click and drag.
It will automatically show all data from the plots within the same leaf of the VisualTree. If you want to refer other plots as well, you can use the AddAdditionalPlotReference method. For example when using the TwinScrolling plot with two plots synced in X, you may want to show extra data from plot B while hovering over plot A.
The control assumes that the X data for all graphs (across all plots) are the same and will show only that of the first evaluated plot.

member.name: T:Keysight.Aes.Asf.WPF.Plotting.PlotToolBox.ToolTipModes
member.summary: Values that represent tool tip modes.

member.name: F:Keysight.Aes.Asf.WPF.Plotting.PlotToolBox.ToolTipModes.AllVertical
member.summary: All data on the vertical line corresponding the mouse position is displayed in the tooltip.

member.name: F:Keysight.Aes.Asf.WPF.Plotting.PlotToolBox.ToolTipModes.ClosestVertical
member.summary: Only the one point on the vertical line that is closest to the mouse is displayed.

member.name: F:Keysight.Aes.Asf.WPF.Plotting.PlotToolBox.ToolTipModes.ClosestAndRelated
member.summary: The closest point in any plot determines the graph index from each layer for which the information is displayed.

member.name: P:Keysight.Aes.Asf.WPF.Plotting.PlotToolBox.ToolTipMode
member.summary: Gets or sets the tool tip mode.

member.name: F:Keysight.Aes.Asf.WPF.Plotting.PlotToolBox.ToolTipModeProperty
member.summary: The tool tip mode property.

member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the tool tip is enabled.
member.value: true if the tool tip is enabled, false if not.

member.summary: The is tool tip enabled property.

member.name: T:Keysight.Aes.Asf.WPF.Plotting.VisualPlot
member.summary: A plot control that will draw a graphical representation of Y only or combined X/Y data. It makes use of WPF Visuals which do not keep a reference to the actually drawn pixels (it works more like the GDI drawing commands). Hence it's faster than using a Geometry based plot. If your application needs performance and you do not plan on offering user interaction, this is the recommended control. Otherwise, the GeometryPlot is likely a better alternative.

member.name: M:Keysight.Aes.Asf.WPF.Plotting.VisualPlot.#ctor
member.summary: Default constructor.

member.name: P:Keysight.Aes.Asf.WPF.Plotting.VisualPlot.AutoAggregate
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether the displayed data will automatically be aggregated during a render pass. You can set this to false for large amounts of data that you want to aggregate externally and not on each change of the controls size etc.

member.summary: The aggregate method property.

member.name: P:Keysight.Aes.Asf.WPF.Plotting.VisualPlot.AggregateOverscan
member.summary: Gets or sets the factor that determines the amount of data points to aggregate in relation to the control's actual width. E.g. at 1.0 exactly one data point per screen pixel is derived, at 2.0 it's two points per pixel resulting in a smoother curve and at 0.5 it's one plot point every two screen pixels resulting in better WPF drawing performance.

member.name: T:Keysight.Aes.Asf.WPF.Plotting.GeometryPlot
member.summary: A very simple trend plot control without any fancy features like zoom or scroll. The GeometryPlot makes use of WPF geometries, which is the slowest method but keeps control over every painted pixel and thus would eventually allow for user feedback and interaction e.g. when hovering or clicking on the plot. However none of this is currently implemented, this class serves merely as an example. If you need more performance and can afford losing potential interaction capabilities, the VisualPlot is an alternative.

member.name: T:Keysight.Aes.Asf.Solutions.Catalog.SolutionCatalog
member.summary:
Provides access to the stored solution configurations. A configuration is identified by a unique name which exists only once on the local machine, regardless of the actual configuration class type. I.e. a configuration for a Solution of type A can not be stored under a name already used for a Solution Configuration of type B.
Note that all functions returning configurations will actually provide a clone of the instances stored in the catalog. Thus if you do any changes to such an instance, the catalog will not be affected. You have to use SetConfiguration() to store changes in the catalog.
The current implementation is Thread Safe but not concurrent across multiple tasks. Each task will manage it's own catalog in memory.

member.name: F:Keysight.Aes.Asf.Solutions.Catalog.SolutionCatalog.C_DEFAULT_NAME
member.summary: The default name if the catalog service creates a new configuration from scratch.

member.name: T:Keysight.Aes.Asf.Solutions.ExpertSolutions.AutomaticCsvExporter
member.summary: A class that performs an automatic CSV export, typically used during measurements to write out each line of incoming data. The automatic export will distinguish incoming types of data and will write different types to different files. To reset the automatic export (so that new files are created upon the next export call) use the InitializeAutoCsvExport() method, to announce new measurements, use PerformAutoCsvExport() with the class instance holding one row of data.

member.name: P:Keysight.Aes.Asf.Solutions.ExpertSolutions.AutomaticCsvExporter.AutoCsvExportFile
member.summary: Gets or sets the automatic CSV export base file name that is currently in use. If no test was started yet, this string is empty. If the string is not empty, it doesn't mean that any file exists yet (the auto export may be turned off). The actually written files will have a number and ".csv" extensions not included here. These are created on the fly depending on the various types of result classes that are created by the test.

member.name: M:Keysight.Aes.Asf.Solutions.ExpertSolutions.AutomaticCsvExporter.InitializeAutoCsvExport(Keysight.Aes.Asf.Solutions.ExpertSolutions.ExpertDescriptor,Keysight.Aes.Asf.MVVM.ViewModels.AutoCsvExportSettings)
member.summary: Initializes the automatic CSV export. Call this every time you want to reset the export and start a new file. Note that the file is not created unless AutoCsvExport() is called.

member.name: M:Keysight.Aes.Asf.Solutions.ExpertSolutions.AutomaticCsvExporter.PerformAutoCsvExport(System.Object)
member.summary: Automatically adds the values of the public properties of the class instance to the CSV export file, provided IsExportEnabled is true.

member.name: T:Keysight.Aes.Asf.Solutions.ExpertSolutions.ExpertCore

member.summary: Initializes the test. If initialization fails due to the solution core throwing an exception (e.g. invalid parameters or instruments), a previously gained control is lost and RequestControl() has to be called again.
member.exception: Thrown when the test is already in progress or when RequestControl was not called first.
member.returns: true if the initialization succeeded, false if not.

member.summary: Attempts to start the test. This will only return once the test has finished or failed and any previously gained control is reset.

member.name: M:Keysight.Aes.Asf.Solutions.ExpertSolutions.ExpertCore.StopTest
member.summary: Attempts to stop the test on the next opportunity for a clean shutdown. Will return immediately while the test may still be running. Assign a TestStopped Delegate to get informed when it's actually stopped.
member.returns: true if the request was forwarded, false if no test is running.

member.name: M:Keysight.Aes.Asf.Solutions.ExpertSolutions.ExpertCore.AbortTest
member.summary:
Attempts to abort the test on the next available time slot. For this to work, you need to leave the TestSleepDelegate set to it's default value. If you overwrite it, you need to throw an exception in your own TestSleepDelegate in order to abort the test.
Will return immediately while the test may still be running. Assign a TestStopped Delegate to get informed when it's actually stopped.
member.returns: true if an abort request was forwarded, false if no test is running.

member.name: M:Keysight.Aes.Asf.Solutions.ExpertSolutions.ExpertEngine.StartTest(System.Object)
member.summary: Asynchronously starts the test. If the test is already running, the method returns false and will not store the user object. To get informed about the test proceedings, you need to subscribe to the various available events.
member.exception: Thrown when the solution configuration could not be loaded or if no TestSetup was provided.
member.param: A user definable object that can be retrieved from the sender instance's UserOb property on event callbacks.
member.returns: true if the test was started and the user object was stored, false if the test could not be started because it is already running (in which case the user object is not stored).

member.name: M:Keysight.Aes.Asf.Solutions.ExpertSolutions.ExpertEngine.StopTest
member.summary: Informs a test in progress that a test stop was requested. The method returns immediately. If a test is in progress, it will be stopped on the next finished iteration cycle and the TestStopEvent is called.
member.remarks: Note that when overriding the implementation, you need to make sure the test is stopped either immediately or asynchronously and that any state changes are issued via the appropriate events, no matter whether you stop immediately or not.
member.returns: true if a running test was informed to stop as soon as possible. False if no test is running.

member.name: T:Keysight.Aes.Asf.Solutions.SolutionConfiguration
member.summary:
The base class to hold the configuration for a solution. For your solution, derive from this class and add all the properties like instrument (VISA) addresses, channel numbers, probe types etc. that define the solution setup and are NOT considered to be user configurable (as for example through an exposed property in a TAP test step).
You should decorate your derived class with the DisplayName attribute which should contain the product number and a short name of the solution, e.g. "BT2191A Self-Discharge Measurement".
You can also set the SolutionColor and SolutionToken properties in your constructor, otherwise individual ones will be assigned automatically. The Color is used for grouping in the Solution Configurator GUI and the token is used to give a brief (3 to 5 letter) representation of the solution (e.g. the product number or an abbreviation like "SDM" for Self-Discharge Measurement).
Class instances are serialized to XML. Therefore, all the controlling attributes from the System.Xml.Serialization namespace can be used if there is any desire to do so. All public fields AND properties will be serialized. The serialization is fully version tolerant, i.e. when deserializing different versions of xml and class types, extra elements in the xml but missing in the class will be ignored and missing elements in the xml will be filled in with the .NET default values (this is the standard behaviour of the .NET XmlSerializer).
Note that for screen presentation in the Solution Configurator GUI, ONLY PUBLIC PROPERTIES will be displayed; fields will be ignored.
For on screen presentation, properties can be marked with the Attributes from the System.ComponentModel namespace. The number of attributes that are actually evaluated by the Solution Configurator GUI may change across versions. Here are a few examples:
Browsable Determines whether the Property is visible in the Solution Configurator GUI Instead of setting this to false, you may as well just use a Field. Description Will be displayed as a tooltip or similar in the Solution Configurator GUI DisplayName The property name as displayed to the user.
When implementing your solution logic, you will want to write out the XML file with the intellisense help. For your configuration class, the attributes will probably suffice since only the configuration editor has to work with the class. To avoid warnings for all your public properties about missing XML comments, you can surround them with
#pragma warning disable 1591 ...all your properties without comments go here... #pragma warning restore 1591

member.name: F:Keysight.Aes.Asf.Solutions.SolutionConfiguration.Version
member.summary: Gets or sets the version of your configuration class. This defaults to 1. Make sure to increase this in your constructor whenever you add or change elements of your class. This will allow you to notice when an older version of a setup has been loaded and thus new (mandatory) properties may be missing or filled in with default values.

member.name: T:Keysight.Aes.Asf.Solutions.SolutionInteractions
member.summary: This class allows a solution core to send feedback information back to a hosting instance (which could be a UI, an automated test wrapper etc.). The wrapper has to instantiate the class and populate the delegates, then hand the reference to the solution core. If no delegates are set, then by default all feedback will be sent to the application log.

member.name: T:Keysight.Aes.Asf.Solutions.SolutionInteractions.UserFeedbackAction
member.summary: Provides user feedback during a test or process. This will typically go to a non-modal control, like a window status bar, a ProgressView control etc. or may be rerouted to a log during automated testing. All values set to null will remain on screen unchanged. To hide a progress bar, set the ProgressMinimum and ProgressMaximum both to zero.

member.summary: Default constructor.

member.name: P:Keysight.Aes.Asf.Solutions.SolutionInteractions.SetUserFeedback

member.summary: Registers the user feedback presenter.

member.name: M:Keysight.Aes.Asf.Scpi.ScpiFormats.RetrieveDouble(System.String,System.Boolean)

true to allow, false to deny MIN and MAX as a value. If allowed, it'll return double.MinValue and double.MaxValue accordingly.
