A double[] containing the samples of the cosine.
### Thrown when numberOfPeriods or totalNumberOfSamples are not greater than 0.

member.name: T:Keysight.Aes.Asf.SignalProcessing.WindowFunctions
member.summary: A collection of window functions for signal processing.

member.name: M:Keysight.Aes.Asf.SignalProcessing.WindowFunctions.Blackman(System.Int32,System.Double)
member.summary: Generates the coefficients for a symmetric Blackman window. Note: For proper amplitude values, gain correction needs to be done after applying the window function to a signal.
member.exception: Thrown when alpha parameter is smaller than 0 or greater than 1, or when length is smaller than 2.
member.param: The length of the Blackman window. Must match the length of the signal to which the window is applied to.
(Optional) the alpha factor for the Blackman window. Value must be between 0 and 1.
member.returns: Length number of coefficients of the Blackman window.

member.name: M:Keysight.Aes.Asf.SignalProcessing.WindowFunctions.Hann(System.Int32)
member.summary: Generates the coefficients for a symmetric Hann window. Note: For proper amplitude values, gain correction needs to be done after applying the window function to a signal.
member.param: The length of the Hann window. Must match the length of the signal to which the window is applied to.
member.returns: Length number of coefficients of the Hann window.

member.name: M:Keysight.Aes.Asf.SignalProcessing.WindowFunctions.Hamming(System.Int32,System.Double)
member.summary: Generates the coefficients for a symmetric Hamming window. Note: For proper amplitude values, gain correction needs to be done after applying the window function to a signal.
member.exception: Thrown when one or more arguments have unsupported or illegal values.
member.param: The length of the Hamming window. Must match the length of the signal to which the window is applied to.
(Optional) the alpha factor for the Hamming window. Value must be between 0 and 1.
member.returns: Length number of coefficients of the Hamming window.

member.name: M:Keysight.Aes.Asf.SignalProcessing.WindowFunctions.ApplyBlackmanWindow(System.Double[],System.Boolean,System.Double)
member.summary: Applies the blackman window on an input signal, and corrects gain distortion.
member.param: The signal to apply the Blackman window on.
(Optional) the alpha factor for the Blackman window. Value must be between 0 and 1.
member.returns: The signal with the applied Blackman window and gain correction, if chosen.

member.name: T:Keysight.Aes.Asf.Types.ArrayExtensions
member.summary: Holds extension methods for the .NET Array type.

member.name: M:Keysight.Aes.Asf.Types.ArrayExtensions.Redim``1(``0[],System.Int32)
member.summary: Creates a new array of the desired size, copies the existing data as appropriate and returns the new array. If the new array is larger, the newly added elements will be initialized with the .NET default value for the particular type. If the new array is smaller, only the appropriate amount of elements will be copied.
member.returns: The new array.
member.example:
You need to make use of the return value to get hold of the new array:
myArray = myArray.Redim(20);

member.name: M:Keysight.Aes.Asf.Types.ArrayExtensions.TrimStart``1(``0[],System.Int32)
member.summary: Creates a new array without the first n elements of the existing array. If the number of elements to trim exceeds the number of total elements in the array, an empty array is returned.
member.param: The number of elements to cut away from the start of the array.
member.returns: The new array.
member.example:
You need to make use of the return value to get hold of the new array:
myArray = myArray.TrimStart(10);

member.name: M:Keysight.Aes.Asf.Types.ArrayExtensions.TrimEnd``1(``0[],System.Int32)
member.summary: Creates a new array without the last n elements of the existing array. If the number of elements to trim exceeds the number of total elements in the array, an empty array is returned.
member.param: The number of elements to cut away from the start of the array.
member.returns: The new array.
member.example:
You need to make use of the return value to get hold of the new array:
myArray = myArray.TrimStart(10);

member.name: M:Keysight.Aes.Asf.Types.ArrayExtensions.Append``1(``0[],``0[])
member.summary: Creates a new array that can take the data of two existing arrays and copies that data to the new array.
member.returns: The new array.
member.example:
You need to make use of the return value to get hold of the new array:
myArray = myArray.Append(otherArray);

member.name: M:Keysight.Aes.Asf.Types.ArrayExtensions.IndexOf``1(``0[],``0[])
member.summary: Searches for an array inside an array like IndexOf works on strings. The .NET Array.IndexOf method tries to find the whole searchPattern as one object at a particular index. This method does an item by item comparison instead and treats each item of the searchPattern as an individual item in the source array.
member.param: The array item sequence to seach for. If this array is empty, 0 is returned.
member.returns: The zero-based index of the found array, or -1 if no match was found.

member.name: T:Keysight.Aes.Asf.VirtualVisa.ChannelInstrument
member.summary:
Implements an instrument that can interpret commands that are designated at a certain slot and channel according to the syntax '(@sccc)' like for example implemented in the 34980A.
You provide a command interpreter for regular commands via the CommandExectuor delegate in the base Instrument class. With the ChannelInstrument, you provide an additional interpreter for designated commands via the DesignatedCommandExecutor.

member.name: T:Keysight.Aes.Asf.VirtualVisa.ChannelInstrument.DesignatedCommandExecutor
member.summary: The delegate definition for calls to execute designated commands.
member.returns: A reply to the command where applicable, e.g. a requested measurement.

member.name: F:Keysight.Aes.Asf.VirtualVisa.ChannelInstrument.DesignatedExecuteCommandDelegate
member.summary: The delegate to actually execute designated commands.

member.param: The identification must follow the scheme "Vendor.Model.Serial.Firmware".

member.summary: Constructor.
member.param: The identification must follow the scheme "Vendor.Model.Serial.Firmware".
The port number to listen on.

true if the command is a request.

member.name: F:Keysight.Aes.Asf.VirtualVisa.DxInstruments.DxVoetschClimateChamberData.HelpCommand
member.summary: This command returns a list of all available commands for the chamber This command is the same for all chambers.

member.summary: This command returns the current failure: <Failure Number><Space><Failure Text><CR> Example: 16 Netzwiederkehr<CR> or 0 <CR> (no error) This command is the same for all chambers.

member.name: F:Keysight.Aes.Asf.VirtualVisa.DxInstruments.DxVoetschClimateChamberData.ResetFailuresCommand
member.summary: This command resets the failures of the chamber and returns the number of not reset failures xx<CR> , where xx stays for the amount of failures which are still there and were not reset. This command is the same for all chambers.

member.name: F:Keysight.Aes.Asf.VirtualVisa.DxInstruments.DxVoetschClimateChamberData.StartProgramCommand
member.summary: This command starts a predefined program This command is the same for all chambers.

member.name: F:Keysight.Aes.Asf.VirtualVisa.DxInstruments.DxVoetschClimateChamberData.StopProgramCommand
member.summary: This command stops any running command. This command is the same for all chambers.

member.name: F:Keysight.Aes.Asf.VirtualVisa.DxInstruments.DxVoetschClimateChamberData.GetStateCommand
member.summary: Command to read the status of the chamber. This command is the same for all chambers. The format of the answer is different for the chamber types.

member.name: P:Keysight.Aes.Asf.VirtualVisa.DxInstruments.DxVoetschClimateChamberData.Temperature
member.summary: The target temperature or the current temperature of the climate chamber depending on the communication direction.

member.name: P:Keysight.Aes.Asf.VirtualVisa.DxInstruments.DxVoetschClimateChamberData.ProgramNumber
member.summary: Program number for the chamber programs. Allowed numbers between 1 and 9999

member.name: P:Keysight.Aes.Asf.VirtualVisa.DxInstruments.DxVoetschClimateChamberData.ChamberNumber
member.summary: The number of the chamber which is connected to the network. Normally only one chamber at a time is connected therefore the default value is 1.

member.summary: Defines the On/Off state of the chamber True = On False = Off

member.name: T:Keysight.Aes.Asf.VirtualVisa.DxInstrument`1
member.summary:
The base class for DX instruments adding a generic type for the setup class. Note: All the properties in your setup class must have an initial value assigned that is not the default value. This is checked by the IntergrationTests. The reason for this is that otherwise the default value properties wouldn't show up when serializing and so the example config file created by the SolutionService would be pointless for the user.
Note that when you implement an instrument for release, you need to add a DisplayName attribute to your class to make it appear in the DeviceManager.

member.name: M:Keysight.Aes.Asf.VirtualVisa.ScpiInstrument.ExecuteCommand(System.String[],System.String[],Keysight.Aes.Asf.VirtualVisa.ScpiInstrument.SessionInfo)
member.summary: You do not have to derive from Instrument to implement standard behavior. Instead just provide the ExecuteCommandDelegate which is called for all commands that the server does not reply to by default (i.e. all mandatory SCPI-99 commands) Implement different device behavior by overriding this method. You can use SendReply(session, message) to reply to the client. Call the base class implementation to have the Identification request handled by default.
member.param: The SCPI commands already split by the colon and all upper case.
The SCPI arguments already split by the colon and all upper case.

member.name: M:Keysight.Aes.Asf.XML.ISelfXmlSerializer.ToXml
member.summary: Converts this object to an XML node that can be inserted into any XML document.
member.returns: This object as a string.

member.name: M:Keysight.Aes.Asf.XML.ISelfXmlSerializer.FromXml(System.String)
member.summary: Initializes this object from the given XML string.

member.name: T:Keysight.Aes.Asf.XML.SelfSerializer
member.summary: A base class that implements methods to self de/serialize instances. This uses the default .NET XML and Binary Serializers, so your derived class can decorate properties with all the usual attributes. However be aware of the performance issues the default serializers have. For a simple serializer that is much faster but limited to base types, look at the XmlHelper.

member.name: M:Keysight.Aes.Asf.XML.SelfSerializer.ToBytes
member.summary: Converts this object to a binary representation.
member.returns: This object as a byte[].

member.name: M:Keysight.Aes.Asf.XML.SelfSerializer.FromBytes``1(System.Byte[])
member.summary: Initializes a new class instance of a particular (derived) type from the given binary representation.
member.returns: A configuration instance of type T.

member.name: M:Keysight.Aes.Asf.XML.SelfSerializer.ToXmlBytes
member.summary: Converts this object to an XML string and encodes this into UTF8 bytes.
member.returns: This object as a byte[].

member.name: M:Keysight.Aes.Asf.XML.SelfSerializer.FromXmlBytes``1(System.Byte[])
member.summary: Initializes a new class instance of a particular (derived) type from the given UTF8 encoded XML string.
member.returns: A configuration instance of type T.

member.summary: Converts this object to an XML string.
member.returns: This object as a string.

member.summary: Initializes a new class instance of a particular (derived) type from the given XML string.

member.name: M:Keysight.Aes.Asf.XML.Serializer.ToXml(System.Object,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Converts a class instance to an XML string.
member.param: true to omit the XML declaration. Use this if you want to create a node.
member.returns: This object as a string.

member.name: M:Keysight.Aes.Asf.XML.Serializer.FromXml``1(System.String,System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Initializes a new object (instance) of a particular type from the given XML string.
member.param: true if the xml is only a node and not a whole document.

true if T is object to try and determine the actual type. Note that for example for all system array types this will typically fail since the serializer writes out type names that this code doesnt know how to reconstruct it to an actual type.
member.returns: The deserialized object.

member.name: M:Keysight.Aes.Asf.XML.Serializer.FromXml(System.String,System.Type,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Initializes a new object (instance) of a particular type from the given XML string.
member.param: true if the xml is only a node and not a whole document.
member.returns: The deserialized object.

member.name: T:Keysight.Aes.Asf.XML.TypeSerializer
member.summary: Contains helper methods to (de)serialize a .NET type to and from XML. This will only use the assembly qualified type name.

member.name: M:Keysight.Aes.Asf.XML.TypeSerializer.ToXml(System.Type)
member.summary: Serializes a Type to XML.
member.returns: XML as string.

member.name: M:Keysight.Aes.Asf.XML.TypeSerializer.FromXml(System.String)
member.summary: Deserializes a Type from the given XML.
member.returns: A Type or null if it could not be determined.

member.name: T:Keysight.Aes.Asf.Visa.VisaFormats
member.summary: Helper methods for handling VISA related data.

member.name: M:Keysight.Aes.Asf.Visa.VisaFormats.GetIpAddress(System.String)
member.summary: Gets the IP address portion from a VISA address. The address must be formatted according to the "TCPIPx::IPAddress::*" like one of the following: "TCPIP0::127.0.0.1::5025::SOCKET" "TCPIP0::127.0.0.1::inst0::INSTR". The extracted part is not checked for actual IP validity.
member.returns: The presumed IP address.
